metadata.synopsis: In this hand-drawn animated tale, elderly married couple Hilda (Peggy Ashcroft) and Jim Bloggs (John Mills) have their quiet, simple lives in the English countryside interrupted when they learn of an impending nuclear attack. Not completely understanding the gravity of their situation, Hilda and Jim react archaically and insufficiently after the attack -- and the film takes a dark turn as the radiation begins taking its toll on the unsuspecting couple.

reviews: A bleak, but lavishly animated marvel.
A jewel, with capital letters, of the animated cinema of all time. [Full Review in Spanish]
What begins as a comfy film about an old (if stubborn) British couple in their twilight years becomes a scathing attack on apathy.
Political documents from prior generations can't help but lose their force, and yet this is just as powerful now as it ever could have been.
The images from the movie are haunting, and have stuck with me the past few days, but I feel like maybe I've dragged them out of my subconscious, where they no longer belong.
